subject: Re: How can I join developping group?
msgSnippet: Waiting for your explanation how I can fill in missing javadoc and to write automatic tests. See my answers below quoted text. ... a union ... Ok, I see. You
messageBody:
Waiting for your explanation how I can fill in missing javadoc and to
write automatic tests.

See my answers below quoted text.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Kent Beck" <kentb@...> wrote:
>...our
> philosophy has always been to make JUnit an intersection instead of
a union
> of all useful testing-related functionality.

Ok, I see. You don't want to add new feature unless it will be useful
to everybody. You don't want to overload the core.

> The next steps I would suggest for you are:
> 1) Do something to accelerate the 4.5 release, like fill in missing
> javadoc.
> 2) Add automated tests to your feature requests.

How can I add automated tests or add javadoc if I don't have write
rights to CVS? It will be pleasure for me to help you. I just want to
know how can I technically do it.


> Beginning to contribute to an existing project is a little like going to
> someone else's home. If you are demanding, if you rearrange all the
> furniture, if, in short, you act like you are the most important
person in
> the room, then you are unlikely to be welcome. If you listen
carefully and
> offer to help, you have a chance of building a relationship that
will help
> you feel at home and prepare the way for a closer relationship.

I understand your point. You see, I don't want to change your design,
rewrite your code or to add significant amount of new features. I want
only to add enhancements / improvements to existing one. In other
words, I don't want to rearrange the furniture I want to add some
decorative elements to your room.
